Class.Name: NSView
Class.Description: The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.

InstanceMethods.Name: initWithFrame:
InstanceMethods.Description: Initializes and returns a newly allocated NSView object with a specified frame rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: prepareForReuse
InstanceMethods.Description: Restores the view to an initial state so that it can be reused.

InstanceMethods.Name: addSubview:
InstanceMethods.Description: Adds a view to the view’s subviews so it’s displayed above its siblings.

InstanceMethods.Name: addSubview:positioned:relativeTo:
InstanceMethods.Description: Inserts a view among the view’s subviews so it’s displayed immediately above or below another view.

InstanceMethods.Name: didAddSubview:
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to perform additional actions when subviews are added to the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeFromSuperview
InstanceMethods.Description: Unlinks the view from its superview and its window, removes it from the responder chain, and invalidates its cursor rectangles.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeFromSuperviewWithoutNeedingDisplay
InstanceMethods.Description: Unlinks the view from its superview and its window and removes it from the responder chain, but does not invalidate its cursor rectangles to cause redrawing.

InstanceMethods.Name: replaceSubview:with:
InstanceMethods.Description: Replaces one of the view’s subviews with another view.

InstanceMethods.Name: isDescendantOf:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns YES if the view is a subview of a given view or if it’s identical to that view; otherwise, it returns NO.

InstanceMethods.Name: ancestorSharedWithView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the closest ancestor shared by the view and another specified view.

InstanceMethods.Name: sortSubviewsUsingFunction:context:
InstanceMethods.Description: Orders the view's immediate subviews using the specified comparator function.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewDidMoveToSuperview
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view that its superview has changed (possibly to nil).

InstanceMethods.Name: viewDidMoveToWindow
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view that it has been added to a new view hierarchy.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewWillMoveToSuperview:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view that its superview is about to change to the specified superview (which may be nil).

InstanceMethods.Name: viewWillMoveToWindow:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view that it’s being added to the view hierarchy of the specified window object (which may be nil).

InstanceMethods.Name: willRemoveSubview:
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to perform additional actions before subviews are removed from the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: setFrameOrigin:
InstanceMethods.Description: Sets the origin of the view’s frame rectangle to the specified point, effectively repositioning it within its superview.

InstanceMethods.Name: setFrameSize:
InstanceMethods.Description: Sets the size of the view’s frame rectangle to the specified dimensions, resizing it within its superview without affecting its coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: setBoundsOrigin:
InstanceMethods.Description: Sets the origin of the view’s bounds rectangle to a specified point.

InstanceMethods.Name: setBoundsSize:
InstanceMethods.Description: Sets the size of the view’s bounds rectangle to specified dimensions, inversely scaling its coordinate system relative to its frame rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: makeBackingLayer
InstanceMethods.Description: Creates the view’s backing layer.

InstanceMethods.Name: updateLayer
InstanceMethods.Description: Updates the view’s content by modifying its underlying layer.

InstanceMethods.Name: drawRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to draw the view’s image within the specified rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: getRectsBeingDrawn:count:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns by indirection a list of nonoverlapping rectangles that define the area the view is being asked to draw in drawRect:.

InstanceMethods.Name: needsToDrawRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified rectangle intersects any part of the area that the view is being asked to draw.

InstanceMethods.Name: bitmapImageRepForCachingDisplayInRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns a bitmap-representation object suitable for caching the specified portion of the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: cacheDisplayInRect:toBitmapImageRep:
InstanceMethods.Description: Draws the specified area of the view, and its descendants, into a provided bitmap-representation object.

InstanceMethods.Name: print:
InstanceMethods.Description: This action method opens the Print panel, and if the user chooses an option other than canceling, prints the view and all its subviews to the device specified in the Print panel.

InstanceMethods.Name: beginPageInRect:atPlacement:
InstanceMethods.Description: Called at the beginning of each page, this method sets up the coordinate system so that a region inside the view’s bounds is translated to a specified location.

InstanceMethods.Name: dataWithEPSInsideRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns EPS data that draws the region of the view within a specified rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: dataWithPDFInsideRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns PDF data that draws the region of the view within a specified rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: writeEPSInsideRect:toPasteboard:
InstanceMethods.Description: Writes EPS data that draws the region of the view within a specified rectangle onto a pasteboard.

InstanceMethods.Name: writePDFInsideRect:toPasteboard:
InstanceMethods.Description: Writes PDF data that draws the region of the view within a specified rectangle onto a pasteboard.

InstanceMethods.Name: drawPageBorderWithSize:
InstanceMethods.Description: Allows applications that use the AppKit pagination facility to draw additional marks on each logical page.

InstanceMethods.Name: drawSheetBorderWithSize:
InstanceMethods.Description: Allows applications that use the AppKit pagination facility to draw additional marks on each printed sheet.

InstanceMethods.Name: adjustPageWidthNew:left:right:limit:
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to adjust page width during automatic pagination.

InstanceMethods.Name: adjustPageHeightNew:top:bottom:limit:
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to adjust page height during automatic pagination.

InstanceMethods.Name: knowsPageRange:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns YES if the view handles page boundaries, NO otherwise.

InstanceMethods.Name: rectForPage:
InstanceMethods.Description: Implemented by subclasses to determine the portion of the view to be printed for the specified page number.

InstanceMethods.Name: locationOfPrintRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Invoked by print: to determine the location of the region of the view being printed on the physical page.

InstanceMethods.Name: setNeedsDisplayInRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Marks the region of the view within the specified rectangle as needing display, increasing the view’s existing invalid region to include it.

InstanceMethods.Name: display
InstanceMethods.Description: Displays the view and all its subviews if possible, invoking each of the NSView methods lockFocus, drawRect:, and unlockFocus as necessary.

InstanceMethods.Name: displayRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Acts as display, but confining drawing to a rectangular region of the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: displayRectIgnoringOpacity:
InstanceMethods.Description: Displays the view but confines drawing to a specified region and does not back up to the first opaque ancestor—it simply causes the view and its descendants to execute their drawing code.

InstanceMethods.Name: displayRectIgnoringOpacity:inContext:
InstanceMethods.Description: Causes the view and its descendants to be redrawn to the specified graphics context.

InstanceMethods.Name: displayIfNeeded
InstanceMethods.Description: Displays the view and all its subviews if any part of the view has been marked as needing display.

InstanceMethods.Name: displayIfNeededInRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Acts as displayIfNeeded, confining drawing to a specified region of the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: displayIfNeededIgnoringOpacity
InstanceMethods.Description: Acts as displayIfNeeded, except that this method doesn’t back up to the first opaque ancestor—it simply causes the view and its descendants to execute their drawing code.

InstanceMethods.Name: displayIfNeededInRectIgnoringOpacity:
InstanceMethods.Description: Acts as displayIfNeeded, but confining drawing to aRect and not backing up to the first opaque ancestor—it simply causes the view and its descendants to execute their drawing code.

InstanceMethods.Name: translateRectsNeedingDisplayInRect:by:
InstanceMethods.Description: Translates the display rectangles by the specified delta.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewWillDraw
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view that it’s required to draw content.

InstanceMethods.Name: backingAlignedRect:options:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns a backing store pixel-aligned rectangle in local view coordinates.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertPointFromBacking:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a point from its pixel aligned backing store coordinate system to the view’s interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertPointToBacking:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a point from the view’s interior coordinate system to its pixel aligned backing store coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertPointFromLayer:
InstanceMethods.Description: Convert the point from the layer's interior coordinate system to the view’s interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertPointToLayer:
InstanceMethods.Description: Convert the size from the view’s interior coordinate system to the layer's interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertRectFromBacking:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a rectangle from its pixel aligned backing store coordinate system to the view’s interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertRectToBacking:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a rectangle from the view’s interior coordinate system to its pixel aligned backing store coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertRectFromLayer:
InstanceMethods.Description: Convert the rectangle from the layer's interior coordinate system to the view’s interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertRectToLayer:
InstanceMethods.Description: Convert the size from the view’s interior coordinate system to the layer's interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertSizeFromBacking:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a size from its pixel aligned backing store coordinate system to the view’s interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertSizeToBacking:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a size from the view’s interior coordinate system to its pixel aligned backing store coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertSizeFromLayer:
InstanceMethods.Description: Convert the size from the layer's interior coordinate system to the view’s interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertSizeToLayer:
InstanceMethods.Description: Convert the size from the view’s interior coordinate system to the layer's interior coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertPoint:fromView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a point from the coordinate system of a given view to that of the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertPoint:toView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a point from the view’s coordinate system to that of a given view.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertSize:fromView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a size from another view’s coordinate system to that of the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertSize:toView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a size from the view’s coordinate system to that of another view.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertRect:fromView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a rectangle from the coordinate system of another view to that of the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertRect:toView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts a rectangle from the view’s coordinate system to that of another view.

InstanceMethods.Name: centerScanRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts the corners of a specified rectangle to lie on the center of device pixels, which is useful in compensating for rendering overscanning when the coordinate system has been scaled.

InstanceMethods.Name: translateOriginToPoint:
InstanceMethods.Description: Translates the view’s coordinate system so that its origin moves to a new location.

InstanceMethods.Name: scaleUnitSquareToSize:
InstanceMethods.Description: Scales the view’s coordinate system so that the unit square scales to the specified dimensions.

InstanceMethods.Name: rotateByAngle:
InstanceMethods.Description: Rotates the view’s bounds rectangle by a specified degree value around the origin of the coordinate system, (0.0, 0.0).

InstanceMethods.Name: resizeSubviewsWithOldSize:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view’s subviews that the view’s bounds rectangle size has changed.

InstanceMethods.Name: resizeWithOldSuperviewSize:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view that the bounds size of its superview has changed.

InstanceMethods.Name: addConstraint:
InstanceMethods.Description: Adds a constraint on the layout of the receiving view or its subviews.

InstanceMethods.Name: addConstraints:
InstanceMethods.Description: Adds multiple constraints on the layout of the receiving view or its subviews.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeConstraint:
InstanceMethods.Description: Removes the specified constraint from the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeConstraints:
InstanceMethods.Description: Removes the specified constraints from the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: addLayoutGuide:
InstanceMethods.Description: Adds the provided layout guide to the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeLayoutGuide:
InstanceMethods.Description: Removes the provided layout guide from the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: invalidateIntrinsicContentSize
InstanceMethods.Description: Invalidates the view’s intrinsic content size.

InstanceMethods.Name: contentCompressionResistancePriorityForOrientation:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the priority with which a view resists being made smaller than its intrinsic size.

InstanceMethods.Name: setContentCompressionResistancePriority:forOrientation:
InstanceMethods.Description: Sets the priority with which a view resists being made smaller than its intrinsic size.

InstanceMethods.Name: contentHuggingPriorityForOrientation:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the priority with which a view resists being made larger than its intrinsic size.

InstanceMethods.Name: setContentHuggingPriority:forOrientation:
InstanceMethods.Description: Sets the priority with which a view resists being made larger than its intrinsic size.

InstanceMethods.Name: alignmentRectForFrame:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the view’s alignment rectangle for a given frame.

InstanceMethods.Name: frameForAlignmentRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the view’s frame for a given alignment rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: layout
InstanceMethods.Description: Perform layout in concert with the constraint-based layout system.

InstanceMethods.Name: layoutSubtreeIfNeeded
InstanceMethods.Description: Updates the layout of the receiving view and its subviews based on the current views and constraints.

InstanceMethods.Name: updateConstraints
InstanceMethods.Description: Update constraints for the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: updateConstraintsForSubtreeIfNeeded
InstanceMethods.Description: Updates the constraints for the receiving view and its subviews.

InstanceMethods.Name: constraintsAffectingLayoutForOrientation:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the constraints impacting the layout of the view for a given orientation.

InstanceMethods.Name: exerciseAmbiguityInLayout
InstanceMethods.Description: Randomly changes the frame of a view with an ambiguous layout between the different valid values.

InstanceMethods.Name: lockFocus
InstanceMethods.Description: Locks the focus on the view, so subsequent commands take effect in the view’s window and coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: lockFocusIfCanDraw
InstanceMethods.Description: Locks the focus to the view atomically if the canDraw method returns YES and returns the value of canDraw.

InstanceMethods.Name: lockFocusIfCanDrawInContext:
InstanceMethods.Description: Locks the focus to the view atomically if drawing can occur in the specified graphics context.

InstanceMethods.Name: unlockFocus
InstanceMethods.Description: Unlocks focus from the current view.

InstanceMethods.Name: drawFocusRingMask
InstanceMethods.Description: Draws the focus ring mask for the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: noteFocusRingMaskChanged
InstanceMethods.Description: Invoked to notify the view that the focus ring mask requires updating.

InstanceMethods.Name: setKeyboardFocusRingNeedsDisplayInRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Invalidates the area around the focus ring.

InstanceMethods.Name: enterFullScreenMode:withOptions:
InstanceMethods.Description: Sets the view to full screen mode.

InstanceMethods.Name: exitFullScreenModeWithOptions:
InstanceMethods.Description: Instructs the view to exit full screen mode.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewDidHide
InstanceMethods.Description: Invoked when the view is hidden, either directly, or in response to an ancestor being hidden.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewDidUnhide
InstanceMethods.Description: Invoked when the view is unhidden, either directly, or in response to an ancestor being unhidden

InstanceMethods.Name: getRectsExposedDuringLiveResize:count:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns a list of rectangles indicating the newly exposed areas of the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewWillStartLiveResize
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view of the start of a live resize—the user has started resizing the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewDidEndLiveResize
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the view of the end of a live resize—the user has finished resizing the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: addGestureRecognizer:
InstanceMethods.Description: Attaches a gesture recognizer to the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeGestureRecognizer:
InstanceMethods.Description: Detaches a gesture recognizer from the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: acceptsFirstMouse:
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to return YES if the view should be sent a mouseDown: message for an initial mouse-down event, NO if not.

InstanceMethods.Name: hitTest:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the farthest descendant of the view in the view hierarchy (including itself) that contains a specified point, or nil if that point lies completely outside the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: mouse:inRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns whether a region of the view contains a specified point, accounting for whether the view is flipped or not.

InstanceMethods.Name: performKeyEquivalent:
InstanceMethods.Description: Implemented by subclasses to respond to key equivalents (also known as keyboard shortcuts).

InstanceMethods.Name: prepareContentInRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Prepares the overdraw region for drawing.

InstanceMethods.Name: scrollPoint:
InstanceMethods.Description: Scrolls the view’s closest ancestor NSClipView object so a point in the view lies at the origin of the clip view's bounds rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: scrollRectToVisible:
InstanceMethods.Description: Scrolls the view’s closest ancestor NSClipView object the minimum distance needed so a specified region of the view becomes visible in the clip view.

InstanceMethods.Name: autoscroll:
InstanceMethods.Description: Scrolls the view’s closest ancestor NSClipView object proportionally to the distance of an event that occurs outside of it.

InstanceMethods.Name: adjustScroll:
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to modify a given rectangle, returning the altered rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: scrollRect:by:
InstanceMethods.Description: Copies the visible portion of the view’s rendered image within a region and lays that portion down again at a specified offset .

InstanceMethods.Name: scrollClipView:toPoint:
InstanceMethods.Description: Notifies the superview of a clip view that the clip view needs to reset the origin of its bounds rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: reflectScrolledClipView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Notifies a clip view’s superview that either the clip view’s bounds rectangle or the document view’s frame rectangle has changed, and that any indicators of the scroll position need to be adjusted.

InstanceMethods.Name: registerForDraggedTypes:
InstanceMethods.Description: Registers the pasteboard types that the view will accept as the destination of an image-dragging session.

InstanceMethods.Name: unregisterDraggedTypes
InstanceMethods.Description: Unregisters the view as a possible destination in a dragging session.

InstanceMethods.Name: beginDraggingSessionWithItems:event:source:
InstanceMethods.Description: Initiates a dragging session with a group of dragging items.

InstanceMethods.Name: dragFile:fromRect:slideBack:event:
InstanceMethods.Description: Initiates a dragging operation from the view, allowing the user to drag a file icon to any application that has window or view objects that accept files.

InstanceMethods.Name: dragPromisedFilesOfTypes:fromRect:source:slideBack:event:
InstanceMethods.Description: Initiates a dragging operation from the view, allowing the user to drag one or more promised files (or directories) into any application that has window or view objects that accept promised file data.

InstanceMethods.Name: shouldDelayWindowOrderingForEvent:
InstanceMethods.Description: Allows the user to drag objects from the view without activating the app or moving the window of the view forward, possibly obscuring the destination.

InstanceMethods.Name: rectForSmartMagnificationAtPoint:inRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the appropriate rectangle to use when magnifying around the specified point.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewDidChangeBackingProperties
InstanceMethods.Description: Responds when the view’s backing store properties change.

InstanceMethods.Name: viewWithTag:
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the view’s nearest descendant (including itself) with a specific tag, or nil if no subview has that tag.

InstanceMethods.Name: addToolTipRect:owner:userData:
InstanceMethods.Description: Creates a tooltip for a defined area in the view and returns a tag that identifies the tooltip rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeAllToolTips
InstanceMethods.Description: Removes all tooltips assigned to the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeToolTip:
InstanceMethods.Description: Removes the tooltip identified by specified tag.

InstanceMethods.Name: addTrackingRect:owner:userData:assumeInside:
InstanceMethods.Description: Establishes an area for tracking mouse-entered and mouse-exited events within the view and returns a tag that identifies the tracking rectangle.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeTrackingRect:
InstanceMethods.Description: Removes the tracking rectangle identified by a tag.

InstanceMethods.Name: addTrackingArea:
InstanceMethods.Description: Adds a given tracking area to the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeTrackingArea:
InstanceMethods.Description: Removes a given tracking area from the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: updateTrackingAreas
InstanceMethods.Description: Invoked automatically when the view’s geometry changes such that its tracking areas need to be recalculated.

InstanceMethods.Name: addCursorRect:cursor:
InstanceMethods.Description: Establishes the cursor to be used when the mouse pointer lies within a specified region.

InstanceMethods.Name: removeCursorRect:cursor:
InstanceMethods.Description: Completely removes a cursor rectangle from the view.

InstanceMethods.Name: discardCursorRects
InstanceMethods.Description: Invalidates all cursor rectangles set up using addCursorRect:cursor:.

InstanceMethods.Name: resetCursorRects
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to define their default cursor rectangles.

InstanceMethods.Name: menuForEvent:
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to return a context-sensitive pop-up menu for a given mouse-down event.

InstanceMethods.Name: willOpenMenu:withEvent:
InstanceMethods.Description: Called just before a contextual menu for a view is opened on screen.

InstanceMethods.Name: didCloseMenu:withEvent:
InstanceMethods.Description: Called after a contextual menu that was displayed from the receiving view has been closed.

InstanceMethods.Name: beginDocument
InstanceMethods.Description: Invoked at the beginning of the printing session, this method sets up the current graphics context.

InstanceMethods.Name: endDocument
InstanceMethods.Description: This method is invoked at the end of the printing session.

InstanceMethods.Name: endPage
InstanceMethods.Description: Writes the end of a conforming page.

InstanceMethods.Name: showDefinitionForAttributedString:atPoint:
InstanceMethods.Description: Shows a window displaying the definition of the attributed string at the specified point.

InstanceMethods.Name: showDefinitionForAttributedString:range:options:baselineOriginProvider:
InstanceMethods.Description: Shows a window displaying the definition of the specified range of the attributed string.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertPointToBase:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts the point from the view’s coordinate system to the base coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertPointFromBase:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts the point from the base coordinate system to the view’s coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertSizeToBase:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts the size from the view’s coordinate system to the base coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertSizeFromBase:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts the size from the base coordinate system to the view’s coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertRectToBase:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts the rectangle from the view’s coordinate system to the base coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: convertRectFromBase:
InstanceMethods.Description: Converts the rectangle from the base coordinate system to the view’s coordinate system.

InstanceMethods.Name: performMnemonic:
InstanceMethods.Description: Implemented by subclasses to respond to mnemonics.

InstanceMethods.Name: shouldDrawColor
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the view is being drawn to an environment that supports color.

InstanceMethods.Name: allocateGState
InstanceMethods.Description: Causes the view to maintain a private graphics state object, which encapsulates all parameters of the graphics environment.

InstanceMethods.Name: gState
InstanceMethods.Description: Returns the identifier for the view’s graphics state object, or 0 if the view doesn’t have a graphics state object.

InstanceMethods.Name: setUpGState
InstanceMethods.Description: Overridden by subclasses to (re)initialize the view’s graphics state object.

InstanceMethods.Name: renewGState
InstanceMethods.Description: Invalidates the view’s graphics state object, if it has one.

InstanceMethods.Name: releaseGState
InstanceMethods.Description: Frees the view’s graphics state object, if it has one.

InstanceMethods.Name: dragImage:at:offset:event:pasteboard:source:slideBack:
InstanceMethods.Description: Initiates a dragging operation from the view, allowing the user to drag arbitrary data with a specified icon into any application that has window or view objects that accept dragged data.
InstanceMethods.Declaration:
- (void)dragImage:(NSImage *)image 
               at:(NSPoint)viewLocation 
           offset:(NSSize)initialOffset 
            event:(NSEvent *)event 
       pasteboard:(NSPasteboard *)pboard 
           source:(id)sourceObj 
        slideBack:(BOOL)slideFlag;

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:didAddMarker:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the client that aRulerView allowed the user to add aMarker.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:didMoveMarker:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the client that aRulerView allowed the user to move aMarker.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:didRemoveMarker:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the client that aRulerView allowed the user to remove aMarker.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:handleMouseDown:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the client that the user has pressed the mouse button while the cursor is in the ruler area of aRulerView.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:shouldAddMarker:
InstanceMethods.Description: Requests permission for aRulerView to add aMarker, an NSRulerMarker being dragged onto the ruler by the user.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:shouldMoveMarker:
InstanceMethods.Description: Requests permission for aRulerView to move aMarker.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:shouldRemoveMarker:
InstanceMethods.Description: Requests permission for aRulerView to remove aMarker.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:willAddMarker:atLocation:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the client that aRulerView will add the new NSRulerMarker, aMarker.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:willMoveMarker:toLocation:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the client that aRulerView will move aMarker, an NSRulerMarker already on the ruler view.

InstanceMethods.Name: rulerView:willSetClientView:
InstanceMethods.Description: Informs the client view that aRulerView is about to be appropriated by newClient.

InstanceProperties.Name: superview
InstanceProperties.Description: The view that is the parent of the current view.

InstanceProperties.Name: subviews
InstanceProperties.Description: The array of views embedded in the current view.

InstanceProperties.Name: window
InstanceProperties.Description: The view’s window object, if it is installed in a window.

InstanceProperties.Name: opaqueAncestor
InstanceProperties.Description: The view’s closest opaque ancestor, which might be the view itself.

InstanceProperties.Name: enclosingMenuItem
InstanceProperties.Description: The menu item containing the view or any of its superviews in the view hierarchy.

InstanceProperties.Name: frame
InstanceProperties.Description: The view’s frame rectangle, which defines its position and size in its superview’s coordinate system.

InstanceProperties.Name: frameRotation
InstanceProperties.Description: The angle of rotation, measured in degrees, applied to the view’s frame rectangle relative to its superview’s coordinate system.

InstanceProperties.Name: bounds
InstanceProperties.Description: The view’s bounds rectangle, which expresses its location and size in its own coordinate system.

InstanceProperties.Name: boundsRotation
InstanceProperties.Description: The angle of rotation, measured in degrees, applied to the view’s bounds rectangle relative to its frame rectangle.

InstanceProperties.Name: wantsLayer
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view uses a layer as its backing store.

InstanceProperties.Name: wantsUpdateLayer
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating which drawing path the view takes when updating its contents.

InstanceProperties.Name: layer
InstanceProperties.Description: The Core Animation layer that the view uses as its backing store.

InstanceProperties.Name: layerContentsPlacement
InstanceProperties.Description: The current layer contents placement policy.

InstanceProperties.Name: layerContentsRedrawPolicy
InstanceProperties.Description: The contents redraw policy for the view’s layer.

InstanceProperties.Name: canDrawSubviewsIntoLayer
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view incorporates content from its subviews into its own layer.

InstanceProperties.Name: layerUsesCoreImageFilters
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view’s layer uses Core Image filters and needs in-process rendering.

InstanceProperties.Name: alphaValue
InstanceProperties.Description: The opacity of the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: frameCenterRotation
InstanceProperties.Description: The rotation angle of the view around the center of its layer.

InstanceProperties.Name: backgroundFilters
InstanceProperties.Description: An array of Core Image filters to apply to the view’s background.

InstanceProperties.Name: compositingFilter
InstanceProperties.Description: The Core Image filter used to composite the view’s contents with its background.

InstanceProperties.Name: contentFilters
InstanceProperties.Description: An array of Core Image filters to apply to the contents of the view and its sublayers.

InstanceProperties.Name: shadow
InstanceProperties.Description: The shadow displayed underneath the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: canDraw
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether drawing commands will produce any results.

InstanceProperties.Name: canDrawConcurrently
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view can draw its contents on a background thread.

InstanceProperties.Name: visibleRect
InstanceProperties.Description: The portion of the view that is not clipped by its superviews.

InstanceProperties.Name: wantsDefaultClipping
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether AppKit’s default clipping behavior is in effect.

InstanceProperties.Name: printJobTitle
InstanceProperties.Description: The view’s print job title.

InstanceProperties.Name: pageHeader
InstanceProperties.Description: A default header string that includes the print job title and date.

InstanceProperties.Name: pageFooter
InstanceProperties.Description: A default footer string that includes the current page number and page count.

InstanceProperties.Name: heightAdjustLimit
InstanceProperties.Description: The fraction of the page that can be pushed onto the next page during automatic pagination to prevent items such as lines of text from being divided across pages.

InstanceProperties.Name: widthAdjustLimit
InstanceProperties.Description: The fraction of the page that can be pushed onto the next page during automatic pagination to prevent items such as small images or text columns from being divided across pages.

InstanceProperties.Name: needsDisplay
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value that determines whether the view needs to be redrawn before being displayed.

InstanceProperties.Name: opaque
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view fills its frame rectangle with opaque content.

InstanceProperties.Name: flipped
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view uses a flipped coordinate system.

InstanceProperties.Name: rotatedFromBase
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view or any of its ancestors has ever had a rotation factor applied to its frame or bounds.

InstanceProperties.Name: rotatedOrScaledFromBase
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view or any of its ancestors has ever had a rotation factor applied to its frame or bounds, or has been scaled from the window’s base coordinate system.

InstanceProperties.Name: autoresizesSubviews
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view applies the autoresizing behavior to its subviews when its frame size changes.

InstanceProperties.Name: autoresizingMask
InstanceProperties.Description: The options that determine how the view is resized relative to its superview.

InstanceProperties.Name: bottomAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the bottom edge of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: centerXAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the horizontal center of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: centerYAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the vertical center of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: firstBaselineAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the baseline for the topmost line of text in the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: heightAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the height of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: lastBaselineAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the baseline for the bottommost line of text in the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: leadingAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the leading edge of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: leftAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the left edge of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: rightAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the right edge of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: topAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the top edge of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: trailingAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the trailing edge of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: widthAnchor
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout anchor representing the width of the view’s frame.

InstanceProperties.Name: constraints
InstanceProperties.Description: Returns the constraints held by the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: layoutGuides
InstanceProperties.Description: The array of layout guide objects owned by this view.

InstanceProperties.Name: layoutMarginsGuide
InstanceProperties.Description: A layout guide that provides the recommended amount of padding for content inside of a view.

InstanceProperties.Name: fittingSize
InstanceProperties.Description: The minimum size of the view that satisfies the constraints it holds.

InstanceProperties.Name: intrinsicContentSize
InstanceProperties.Description: The natural size for the receiving view, considering only properties of the view itself.

InstanceProperties.Name: alignmentRectInsets
InstanceProperties.Description: The insets (in points) from the view’s frame that define its content rectangle.

InstanceProperties.Name: baselineOffsetFromBottom
InstanceProperties.Description: The distance (in points) between the bottom of the view’s alignment rectangle and its baseline.

InstanceProperties.Name: firstBaselineOffsetFromTop
InstanceProperties.Description: The distance (in points) between the top of the view’s alignment rectangle and its topmost baseline.

InstanceProperties.Name: lastBaselineOffsetFromBottom
InstanceProperties.Description: The distance (in points) between the bottom of the view’s alignment rectangle and its bottommost baseline.

InstanceProperties.Name: needsLayout
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view needs a layout pass before it can be drawn.

InstanceProperties.Name: needsUpdateConstraints
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view’s constraints need to be updated.

InstanceProperties.Name: translatesAutoresizingMaskIntoConstraints
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view’s autoresizing mask is translated into constraints for the constraint-based layout system.

InstanceProperties.Name: hasAmbiguousLayout
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the constraints impacting the layout of the view incompletely specify the location of the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: focusRingType
InstanceProperties.Description: The type of focus ring drawn around the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: focusRingMaskBounds
InstanceProperties.Description: The focus ring mask bounds, specified in the view’s coordinate space.

InstanceProperties.Name: allowsVibrancy
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view ensures it is vibrant on top of other content.

InstanceProperties.Name: inFullScreenMode
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is in full screen mode.

InstanceProperties.Name: hidden
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is hidden.

InstanceProperties.Name: hiddenOrHasHiddenAncestor
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is hidden from sight because it, or one of its ancestors, is marked as hidden.

InstanceProperties.Name: inLiveResize
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is being rendered as part of a live resizing operation.

InstanceProperties.Name: preservesContentDuringLiveResize
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view optimizes live-resize operations by preserving content that has not moved.

InstanceProperties.Name: rectPreservedDuringLiveResize
InstanceProperties.Description: The rectangle identifying the portion of your view that did not change during a live resize operation.

InstanceProperties.Name: gestureRecognizers
InstanceProperties.Description: The gesture recognize objects currently attached to the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: mouseDownCanMoveWindow
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view can pass mouse down events through to its superviews.

InstanceProperties.Name: inputContext
InstanceProperties.Description: The text input context object for the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: acceptsTouchEvents
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view accepts touch events.

InstanceProperties.Name: wantsRestingTouches
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view wants resting touches.

InstanceProperties.Name: canBecomeKeyView
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view can become key view.

InstanceProperties.Name: needsPanelToBecomeKey
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view needs its panel to become the key window before it can handle keyboard input and navigation.

InstanceProperties.Name: nextKeyView
InstanceProperties.Description: The view object that follows the current view in the key view loop.

InstanceProperties.Name: nextValidKeyView
InstanceProperties.Description: The closest view object in the key view loop that follows the current view in the key view loop and accepts first responder status.

InstanceProperties.Name: previousKeyView
InstanceProperties.Description: The view object preceding the current view in the key view loop.

InstanceProperties.Name: previousValidKeyView
InstanceProperties.Description: The closest view object in the key view loop that precedes the current view and accepts first responder status.

InstanceProperties.Name: preparedContentRect
InstanceProperties.Description: The portion of the view that has been rendered and is available for responsive scrolling.

InstanceProperties.Name: enclosingScrollView
InstanceProperties.Description: The nearest ancestor scroll view that contains the current view.

InstanceProperties.Name: registeredDraggedTypes
InstanceProperties.Description: The array of pasteboard drag types that the view can accept.

InstanceProperties.Name: postsFrameChangedNotifications
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view posts notifications when its frame rectangle changes.

InstanceProperties.Name: postsBoundsChangedNotifications
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view posts notifications when its bounds rectangle changes.

InstanceProperties.Name: tag
InstanceProperties.Description: The view’s tag, which is an integer that you use to identify the view within your app.

InstanceProperties.Name: toolTip
InstanceProperties.Description: The text for the view’s tooltip.

InstanceProperties.Name: trackingAreas
InstanceProperties.Description: An array of the view’s tracking areas.

InstanceProperties.Name: drawingFindIndicator
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view or one of its ancestors is being drawn for a find indicator.

InstanceProperties.Name: userInterfaceLayoutDirection
InstanceProperties.Description: The layout direction for content in the view.

InstanceProperties.Name: wantsBestResolutionOpenGLSurface
InstanceProperties.Description: A Boolean value indicating whether the view wants an OpenGL backing surface with a resolution greater than 1 pixel per point.

InstanceProperties.Name: pressureConfiguration
InstanceProperties.Description: Configures the behavior and progression of the Force Touch trackpad when responding to touch input produced by the user when the cursor is over the view.

TypeProperties.Name: requiresConstraintBasedLayout
TypeProperties.Description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the view depends on the constraint-based layout system.

TypeProperties.Name: focusView
TypeProperties.Description: Returns the currently focused NSView object, or nil if there is none.

TypeProperties.Name: defaultFocusRingType
TypeProperties.Description: Returns the default focus ring type.

TypeProperties.Name: defaultMenu
TypeProperties.Description: Overridden by subclasses to return the default pop-up menu for instances of the receiving class.
